_comment: Example MCP configuration for Chrome DevTools isolated debugging sessions
_note: This configuration should be added to your project's .mcp.json or global Claude Code MCP configuration

chrome-devtools.description: Chrome DevTools MCP for browser debugging with session isolation

mcpServers._comment_playwright: Optional: Playwright MCP as fallback for cross-browser testing
mcpServers._comment_sequential: Sequential Thinking MCP for complex reasoning

sequential-thinking.description: Sequential Thinking MCP for structured multi-step reasoning

mcpServers._comment_context7: Context7 MCP for framework documentation and patterns

context7.description: Context7 MCP for framework-specific documentation and patterns

_usage_notes.isolated_mode: The --isolated=true flag ensures each debugging session gets its own temporary user data directory
_usage_notes.headless_mode: Set --headless=false to see the browser during debugging. Use --headless=true for CI/CD
_usage_notes.user_data_dir: Can be customized per session by overriding USER_DATA_DIR environment variable
_usage_notes.concurrent_sessions: Multiple sessions can run simultaneously with isolated mode enabled
_usage_notes.cleanup: Temporary user data directories are automatically cleaned up when browser closes

debugging_port._note: To specify custom remote debugging port (default: 9222)

_troubleshooting.port_already_in_use: If port 9222 is in use, specify different port with --port flag
_troubleshooting.browser_not_found: Set CHROME_PATH environment variable to Chrome installation path
_troubleshooting.cleanup_issues: Manually delete temp directories in /tmp/claude-debug-* if cleanup fails
